title: 2023: A Critical Juncture for the Global Stablecoin Market
description: Moody’s Senior Director Yiannis Giokas said adoption accelerated this year, despite many destabilizing trends.

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

Argentina's foreign affairs minister has clarified that a recent economic reform decree opens the door to contract settlements in Bitcoin (BTC) and other cryptocurrencies. Meanwhile, a court in the British Virgin Islands has issued a global freezing order of assets to 3AC co-founders Su Zhu and Kyle Davies, and Judge Lewis Kaplan rejected former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried’s request to delay his sentencing hearing.

Argentina's Minister of Foreign Affairs, International Trade and Worship, Diana Mondino, claims that her country has approved the use of Bitcoin (BTC) for contracts and payments.

In a Dec. 21 post on X (formerly Twitter), the policymaker clarified that a recently announced economic reform decree would allow Argentinians to use Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies under certain conditions. The "Bases for the Reconstruction of the Argentine Economy" decree did not mention crypto but included provisions that allowed debtors to pay in certain digital assets that aren't recognized as legal tender.

Read more

title: Shiba Inu and its Impressive 421% Increase after Token Burning
description: Shiba Inu experiences a 421% increase in its burn rate, boosting its market value and attracting global attention.
